required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Efficacy of Baloxavir Marboxil in Healthy Pediatric Participants With Influenza-Like Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Active (Oseltamivir)-Controlled Study to Assess the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Efficacy of Baloxavir Marboxil in Otherwise Healthy Pediatric Patients 1 to <12 Years of Age With Influenza-Like Symptoms

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics, and efficacy of baloxavir marboxil compared with oseltamivir in a single influenza episode in otherwise healthy pediatric participants (i.e., 1 to <12 years of age) with influenza-like symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal (investigational) product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal (investigational) product. A serious adverse event (SAE) is any significant hazard, contraindication, side effect that is fatal or life-threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of an existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/ incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/ birth defect, is medically significant or requires intervention to prevent one or other of the outcomes listed above.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentrations of Baloxavir Marboxil - Sparse PK Population
secondary_outcome.description: Results provided by body-weight groups for participants in the Baloxavir Marboxil arm. Values below lower limit of quantification (0.5 ng/mL) are set to zero.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentrations of S-033447 - Sparse PK Population
secondary_outcome.description: Results provided by body-weight groups for participants in the Baloxavir Marboxil arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentrations of Baloxavir Marboxil - Extensive PK Population
secondary_outcome.description: Results provided by body-weight groups for participants in the Baloxavir Marboxil arm. Values below lower limit of quantification (0.5 ng/mL) are set to zero.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentrations of S-033447 - Extensive PK Population
secondary_outcome.description: Results provided by body-weight groups for participants in the Baloxavir Marboxil arm. Values below lower limit of quantification (0.5 ng/mL) are set to zero.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Alleviation of Influenza Signs and Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Time to alleviation of influenza signs and symptoms is defined as the length of time taken from the start of treatment to the point at which all of the following criteria are met and remain so for at least 21.5 hours: A score of 0 (no problem) or 1 (minor problem) for cough and nasal symptoms (items 14 and 15 of the Canadian Acute Respiratory Illness and Flu Scale [CARIFS]) A "yes" response to the following question on the CARIFS: "Since the last assessment has the subject been able to return to day care/school, or resume his or her normal daily activity in the same way as performed prior to developing the flu?" First return to afebrile state (tympanic temperature ≤37.2 degree Celsius [°C])

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Fever
secondary_outcome.description: Length of time taken by participants to return to afebrile state [tympanic temperature ≤ 37.2°C] and remaining so for at least 21.5 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: The clinical efficacy of baloxavir marboxil is evaluated by duration of symptoms i.e., alleviation of all symptoms as defined by a score of 0 [no problem] or 1 [minor problem] and remaining so for at least 21.5 hours, for all 18 symptoms specified in the CARIFS questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Return to Normal Health and Activity
secondary_outcome.description: Time to Return to Normal health and activity' is identified by a 'Yes' response to the following question on the CARIFS: "Since the last assessment has the patient been able to return to day care/school, or resume his or her normal daily activity in the same way as performed prior to developing the flu?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Influenza-Related Complications
secondary_outcome.description: Influenza related complications include death, hospitalization, radiologically confirmed pneumonia, bronchitis, sinusitis, otitis media, encephalitis/encephalopathy, febrile seizures, myositis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Influenza-Related Complications
secondary_outcome.description: Influenza related complications include death, hospitalization, radiologically confirmed pneumonia, bronchitis, sinusitis, otitis media, encephalitis/encephalopathy, febrile seizures, myositis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Requiring Antibiotics
Time to Cessation of Viral Shedding by Virus Titer
secondary_outcome.description: Time to cessation of viral shedding by virus titer is defined as the time, in hours, between the initiation of any study treatment and first time when the influenza virus titer is below the limit of detection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Cessation of Viral Shedding by RT-PCR
secondary_outcome.description: Time to cessation of viral shedding by RT-PCR, in hours, is defined as the time between the initiation of any study treatment and first time when the virus RNA by RT-PCR is below the limit of detection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Influenza Virus Titer at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
secondary_outcome.description: Influenza virus titer (log10TCID50/ML) is the quantity of influenza virus in a given volume within the samples obtained from nasal swabs. If influenza virus titer was less than the lower limit of quantification, the virus titer was imputed as 0.749 (log10TCID50/mL). A lower value indicates lower viral titer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Amount of Virus RNA (RT-PCR) at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
secondary_outcome.description: If the amount of virus RNA was less than the lower limit of quantification, the amount of virus RNA was imputed as 2.18 for flu A and 2.93 for flu B (log10 virus particles/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Positive Influenza Virus Titer at Day 2, 4, 6, 10
Percentage of Participants Positive by RT-PCR at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
Area Under the Curve in Virus Titer
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve (AUC) in virus titer was calculated using the trapezoidal method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve in the Amount of Virus RNA (RT-PCR)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC in virus RNA (RT-PCR) is defined as AUC of change from baseline in the amount of virus RNA (RT-PCR) from Day 1 to Day 10. AUC is calculated using the trapezoidal method similar to AUC in virus titer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration to Time Curve From Time 0 to Infinity (AUC0-inf) of Baloxavir Marboxil
secondary_outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration to Time Curve From Time 0 to Infinity (AUC0-inf) of S-033447.
secondary_outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Baloxavir Marboxil
secondary_outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of S-033447
secondary_outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Baloxavir Marboxil
secondary_outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of S-033447
secondary_outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentrations of Baloxavir Marboxil by Dosage
secondary_outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentrations of S-033447 by Dosage
secondary_outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.
Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

intervention.description: Baloxavir marboxil will be administered as oral suspension in a single dose on Day 1. Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered as oral suspension twice daily (BID) for 5 days.
Oseltamivir will be administered as oral suspension BID for 5 days. Participants receiving oseltamivir will also receive baloxavir marboxil matching placebo as oral suspension, single dose on Day 1.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 1 to < 12 years at randomization (Day 1).
- Written informed consent/assent for study participation obtained from participant's parents or legal guardian, with assent as appropriate by the participant, depending on the patient's level of understanding
- Participant able to comply with study requirements, depending on the patient's level of understanding
- Participant with a diagnosis of influenza virus infection confirmed by the presence of all of the following:
- Fever ≥ 38 degree celsius (tympanic temperature) at screening
- At least one respiratory symptom (either cough or nasal congestion)
- The time interval between the onset of symptoms and screening is ≤ 48 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe symptoms of influenza virus infection requiring inpatient treatment
- Concurrent infections requiring systemic antiviral therapy at screening
- Require, in the opinion of the investigator, any of the prohibited medication during the study
- Previous treatment with peramivir, laninamivir, oseltamivir, zanamivir, or amantadine within 2 weeks prior to screening
- Immunization with a live/attenuated influenza vaccine in the 2 weeks prior to randomization
- Concomitant treatment with steroids or other immuno-suppressant therapy
- Known HIV infection or other immunosuppressive disorder
- Uncontrolled renal, vascular, neurologic, or metabolic disease (e.g., diabetes, thyroid disorders, adrenal disease), hepatitis, cirrhosis, or pulmonary disease or participants with known chronic renal failure.
- Active cancer at any site
- History of organ transplantation
- Known allergy to either study drug (i.e., baloxavir marboxil and oseltamivir) or to acetaminophen
- Females with child-bearing potential
- Participation in a clinical trial within 4 weeks or five half-lives of exposure to an investigational drug prior to screening, whichever is longer

Complejo Hospitalario Universitario de Santiago (CHUS); Area Asistencial Integrada de Pediatría
Hospital Universitario 12 de Octubre; Servicio de Pediatria

outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal (investigational) product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal (investigational) product. A serious adverse event (SAE) is any significant hazard, contraindication, side effect that is fatal or life-threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of an existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/ incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/ birth defect, is medically significant or requires intervention to prevent one or other of the outcomes listed above.

outcome.title: Plasma Concentrations of Baloxavir Marboxil - Sparse PK Population
outcome.description: Results provided by body-weight groups for participants in the Baloxavir Marboxil arm. Values below lower limit of quantification (0.5 ng/mL) are set to zero.
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consists of all participants that have at least one post-dose drug concentration measurement at a scheduled visit time point. Sparse PK population comprises all participants in the PK population who did not provide informed consent to intensive PK sampling

outcome.title: Time to Alleviation of Influenza Signs and Symptoms
outcome.description: Time to alleviation of influenza signs and symptoms is defined as the length of time taken from the start of treatment to the point at which all of the following criteria are met and remain so for at least 21.5 hours: A score of 0 (no problem) or 1 (minor problem) for cough and nasal symptoms (items 14 and 15 of the Canadian Acute Respiratory Illness and Flu Scale [CARIFS]) A "yes" response to the following question on the CARIFS: "Since the last assessment has the subject been able to return to day care/school, or resume his or her normal daily activity in the same way as performed prior to developing the flu?" First return to afebrile state (tympanic temperature ≤37.2 degree Celsius [°C])
outcome.population: Includes all participants with CARIFS Assessment who have had a laboratory confirmation of influenza infection (polymerase chain reaction [PCR] result) from any swab sample collected at baseline or during the study

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil
group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

First return to afebrile state (tympanic temperature ≤37.2 degree Celsius [°C])

outcome.description: Time to cessation of viral shedding by virus titer is defined as the time, in hours, between the initiation of any study treatment and first time when the influenza virus titer is below the limit of detection.
outcome.population: Includes all participants with post-baseline Virology assessment and a positive virus titer on Day 1

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil
group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

measure.title: Time to Cessation of Viral Shedding by Virus Titer
measure.description: Time to cessation of viral shedding by virus titer is defined as the time, in hours, between the initiation of any study treatment and first time when the influenza virus titer is below the limit of detection.
measure.population: Includes all participants with post-baseline Virology assessment and a positive virus titer on Day 1

outcome.title: Time to Cessation of Viral Shedding by RT-PCR
outcome.description: Time to cessation of viral shedding by RT-PCR, in hours, is defined as the time between the initiation of any study treatment and first time when the virus RNA by RT-PCR is below the limit of detection.
outcome.population: Includes all participants with post-baseline Virology assessment and a positive virus RNA by RT-PCR on Day 1. Participants whose virus RNA did not reach the limit by the last observation time point are treated as censored at that time point.

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil
group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

measure.title: Time to Cessation of Viral Shedding by RT-PCR
measure.description: Time to cessation of viral shedding by RT-PCR, in hours, is defined as the time between the initiation of any study treatment and first time when the virus RNA by RT-PCR is below the limit of detection.
measure.population: Includes all participants with post-baseline Virology assessment and a positive virus RNA by RT-PCR on Day 1. Participants whose virus RNA did not reach the limit by the last observation time point are treated as censored at that time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Influenza Virus Titer at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
outcome.description: Influenza virus titer (log10TCID50/ML) is the quantity of influenza virus in a given volume within the samples obtained from nasal swabs. If influenza virus titer was less than the lower limit of quantification, the virus titer was imputed as 0.749 (log10TCID50/mL). A lower value indicates lower viral titer.
outcome.population: Includes all participants with a positive virus titer on Day 1

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil
group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Influenza Virus Titer at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
measure.description: Influenza virus titer (log10TCID50/ML) is the quantity of influenza virus in a given volume within the samples obtained from nasal swabs. If influenza virus titer was less than the lower limit of quantification, the virus titer was imputed as 0.749 (log10TCID50/mL). A lower value indicates lower viral titer.
measure.population: Includes all participants with a positive virus titer on Day 1

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Amount of Virus RNA (RT-PCR) at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
outcome.description: If the amount of virus RNA was less than the lower limit of quantification, the amount of virus RNA was imputed as 2.18 for flu A and 2.93 for flu B (log10 virus particles/mL)
outcome.population: Includes all participants with positive virus RNA by RT-PCR on Day 1

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil
group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Amount of Virus RNA (RT-PCR) at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
measure.description: If the amount of virus RNA was less than the lower limit of quantification, the amount of virus RNA was imputed as 2.18 for flu A and 2.93 for flu B (log10 virus particles/mL)
measure.population: Includes all participants with positive virus RNA by RT-PCR on Day 1

Insufficient number of participants available to calculate the standard deviation.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Positive Influenza Virus Titer at Day 2, 4, 6, 10
outcome.population: Includes all participants with a positive virus titer on Day 1

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Positive Influenza Virus Titer at Day 2, 4, 6, 10
measure.population: Includes all participants with a positive virus titer on Day 1

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Positive by RT-PCR at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
outcome.population: Includes all participants with positive virus RNA by RT-PCR on Day 1

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil
group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Positive by RT-PCR at Day 2, 4, 6, 10, 15, 29
measure.population: Includes all participants with positive virus RNA by RT-PCR on Day 1

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve in Virus Titer
outcome.description: Area under the curve (AUC) in virus titer was calculated using the trapezoidal method.
outcome.population: Includes all participants with post-baseline Virology assessment and a positive virus titer on Day 1

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil
group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

measure.title: Area Under the Curve in Virus Titer
measure.description: Area under the curve (AUC) in virus titer was calculated using the trapezoidal method.
measure.population: Includes all participants with post-baseline Virology assessment and a positive virus titer on Day 1

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve in the Amount of Virus RNA (RT-PCR)
outcome.description: AUC in virus RNA (RT-PCR) is defined as AUC of change from baseline in the amount of virus RNA (RT-PCR) from Day 1 to Day 10. AUC is calculated using the trapezoidal method similar to AUC in virus titer.
outcome.population: Includes all participants with positive virus RNA by RT-PCR on Day 1 and at least 1 post-baseline test.

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil
group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of baloxavir marboxil on Day 1 (based on body weight). Oseltamivir matching placebo will also be administered orally twice daily (BID) for 5 days.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Participants will receive oseltamivir orally BID for 5 days (based on body weight). Baloxavir marboxil matching placebo will also be administered orally on Day 1

measure.title: Area Under the Curve in the Amount of Virus RNA (RT-PCR)
measure.description: AUC in virus RNA (RT-PCR) is defined as AUC of change from baseline in the amount of virus RNA (RT-PCR) from Day 1 to Day 10. AUC is calculated using the trapezoidal method similar to AUC in virus titer.
measure.population: Includes all participants with positive virus RNA by RT-PCR on Day 1 and at least 1 post-baseline test.

outcome.title: Area Under the Concentration to Time Curve From Time 0 to Infinity (AUC0-inf) of Baloxavir Marboxil
outcome.description: Dose groups correspond to body-weight groups. 2mg/kg dose was used for subjects <20 kgs and 40 mg dose was used for subjects >20 kgs.
outcome.population: The PK population consists of all participants that have at least one post-dose drug concentration measurement at a scheduled visit time point

group.title: Baloxavir Marboxil

measurement_list.measurement: Not estimable as Baloxavir marboxil is a prodrug which is rapidly metabolised into baloxavir. The concentrations are not measurable and do not allow to derive any PK parameters.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
